text:
Hi everyone!

I have a bit of a different question, if you’ll have me.

I’m doing a podcast season dedicated to SaaS rebrands for <https://creatopy.com/> and I’m wondering if anyone knows someone at Medium, Coursera or <http://Anchor.fm|Anchor.fm>. I’ve been trying to reach them for a while but with no results so far.

Any other recommendations are also welcome!

So far I’ve interviews specialists from Unbounce, Typeform, Bitdefender, Auth0, and <http://Wynter.com|Wynter.com> (Peep Laja’s new business).

Thanks so much for your help!

text: Any heads of content/senior content folks have good 1:1 templates for managers who aren’t content people? (My manager is VP Sales and has never manager a content person before)

elements.text: Any heads of content/senior content folks have good 1:1 templates for managers who aren’t content people? (My manager is VP Sales and has never manager a content person before)

text: <@U010JU2GTND>?
I was going to reply the same :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:  cc <@U010JU2GTND>

elements.text: I was going to reply the same
cc

text:
As far as a general template goes, this Asana blog has a good framework for 1-1s as a whole (and applicable to any manager-report relationship, content or sales). I particularly like this as a way to approach an agenda:

• Weekly and monthly priorities
• Feedback on any in-progress assignments
• Checking in on team and company goals
• Identifying and resolving any roadblocks
• Celebrating successes and milestones
• What worked well (and didn’t) on recent projects
• Career goals and learning opportunities
<https://blog.asana.com/2017/12/one-on-one-meeting-agenda/#close>

attachments.title: One-on-one for the books: how to plan productive 1:1 meetings
attachments.text: Day-to-day work can often get in the way of planning a productive one on one meeting agenda. Here are a few simple ways to prep ahead of time.
attachments.fallback: The Asana Blog: One-on-one for the books: how to plan productive 1:1 meetings

text: Hey folks — I am thinking about building out a grid of content marketing awards. Does something like this already exist or does someone have a good resource? I’m primarily looking for video awards, but am trying to become more aware of what the most respected content marketing or digital marketing awards are

text:
Hi content managers and strategists,

I was wondering if you have a template you prefer to use when creating a content strategy from scratch or do you just go through every step and add that. In other words, how do you organize the content marketing plan? Do you focus just on the actionable steps, each with goals? Personally, I like focusing on what needs to be done, what the current content status is, analytics, opportunities, etc. But it all ends up into a massive doc that might feel overwhelming to someone else.

elements.text:
Hi content managers and strategists,

I was wondering if you have a template you prefer to use when creating a content strategy from scratch or do you just go through every step and add that. In other words, how do you organize the content marketing plan? Do you focus just on the actionable steps, each with goals? Personally, I like focusing on what needs to be done, what the current content status is, analytics, opportunities, etc. But it all ends up into a massive doc that might feel overwhelming to someone else.

text:
Following this because I was having the same discussion today. I've used a generic template from NewsCred in the past as a starting point and then customized it. But it doesn't cover everything and it is very much a 30,000 foot view.  I'm also curious to see how others present their content strategy to larger groups.

Here is a link to that template: <https://get.newscred.com/content-marketing-strategy-template/>
